alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clarendon; Richland; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 26 at 11:57PM EDT until March 27 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT FOR CENTRAL CALHOUN...WEST CENTRAL CLARENDON...SOUTHWESTERN SUMTER AND SOUTHEASTERN RICHLAND COUNTIES... At 1156 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Sandy Run, or 15 miles southwest of McEntire Air Base, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include... St. Matthews, Summerton, Eastover, Congaree National Park, Gadsden, Poinsett State Park, Oakland, Pinewood, Dinkins Mill, Rimini, St. Paul, Fort Motte, Wedgewood, Lone Star, Low Falls Landing and Stateburg. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 107 and 108. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. Excessive cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways or walk through high water.
